cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally north-north-east, paralleling the west coast of Florida, then turning northeast toward Apalachee Bay and moving inland across north Florida into Georgia/Alabama as a weakening depression.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood to Suwannee River, FL and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, western Cuba, Florida west coast up to Apalachee Bay, portions of the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late week with sustained winds generally below tropical-storm force (less than 39 mph); peak 34-kt chance only 3%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast given inland track west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands (1â€“2 inches) possible this weekend as the weakening system passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along the southeast Georgia coast due to distant swells.
